etymology.description: Pictogram: a person (大) wearing a headdress (now written 羊) of feathers or ram's horn; modern form seen as ideogrammic compound: 羊 + 大.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a person adorned with a sheep/feather headdress, an image associated with pleasing or auspicious appearance. Later read as the meeting of 羊 and 大, with the sheep element lending positive aesthetic connotations that underlie the sense beautiful.

examples.chinese: 这风景真美(這風景真美)。
她在美留学(她在美留學)。
examples.english: She is studying in the U.S.

examples.chinese: 人们追求美(人們追求美)。
